intro: Calsiama malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar calsiama, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
